methods_proposed.name: Naive Lag-1 Forecast
methods_proposed.description: Uses previous year's area (lag_1) as prediction

methods_proposed.name: Linear Regression with Lag Features
methods_proposed.description: Linear regression using lag_1 and rolling_mean_3y
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_linear_regression(train_df, test_df, target_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
    # Use lag_1 and rolling_mean_3y as features
    X_train = train_df[['lag_1', 'rolling_mean_3y']]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[['lag_1', 'rolling_mean_3y']]
    
    model = LinearRegression()
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest with Lag Features
methods_proposed.description: Random forest using lag_1 and rolling_mean_3y
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_random_forest(train_df, test_df, target_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
    # Use all available features
    X_train = train_df[['lag_1', 'rolling_mean_3y']]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[['lag_1', 'rolling_mean_3y']]
    
    model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
